content.text:
# Recent ElizaOS Updates

The ElizaOS repository has seen significant development with numerous features, bugfixes, and improvements across various components.

## Major Feature Additions

### Knowledge System and Integration
- Separate Knowledge system with Multi-Agent RAG Optimization (PR #1620)
- Implementation of knowledge management methods including getKnowledge, searchKnowledge, createKnowledge, removeKnowledge, and clearKnowledge (PR #2005)

### New Plugins
- Obsidian integration plugin (PR #1943)
- Proof of Pizza - Agentic Dominos Ordering (PR #2042)
- DePIN plugin (PR #1874)
- Giphy plugin for adding animated GIFs to conversations (PR #1873)
- LetzAI plugin (PR #1868)
- RabbiTrader plugin (PR #1785)
- CoinMarketCap plugin (PR #1773)
- CoinGecko plugin (PR #1761)
- Thirdweb plugin (PR #1418)
- Nineteen.ai LLM & image support (PR #2022)

### Blockchain Support
- Improvements for plugin-cosmos (PR #1934)
- Support for Movement Network (PR #1621)
- Improved zkstack based plugins (PR #1821)
- Plugin-nft-generation support for EVM chain (PR #1763)

### Client and API Improvements
- Full overhaul of client (PR #2038)
- Added Telegram API root config in env (PR #2014)
- Updated Galadriel LLM integration to reflect product updates (PR #2011)
- Twitter integration improvements including approval mechanism via Discord bot (PR #1876)
- Made birdeye API request optional (PR #1895)

### Security and Performance
- Support for TEE logging and running eliza in Intel SGX (PR #1470)
- Added Local Embedding Manager to reuse Local embed model, fixing high RAM issues (PR #1950)

## Bugfixes

- Fixed LetzAI build issues and plugin type (PR #2021, #2062)
- Fixed Auto Client bug (PR #2007)
- Resolved translation type issue (PR #1996)
- Fixed build on plugin spheron (PR #1995)
- Updated regex to allow Unicode characters in message processing (PR #2048)
- Fixed case-sensitive column reference in knowledge table CHECK constraint (PR #2058)
- Fixed multiversx-plugin (PR #2017)
- Fixed PGVector embedding validation (PR #1750)
- Included schema.sql and seed.sql in package files (PR #2030)
- Removed defillama plugin & improved rabbi trader (PR #2027)
- Removed near-solana slippage env conflict (PR #2016)
- Fixed isShared double quote issue in adapter-postgres schema (PR #2008)
- Fixed client twitter dryrun (PR #1997)

## Documentation and Maintenance

- Added pnpm lockfile consistency check workflow (PR #2015)
- Replaced console with elizaLogger in plugin-solana (PR #1888)
- Updated .env.example and .env.sample files (PR #2031, #2052)
- Updated README files in multiple languages (PR #2026, #2074, #2069)
- Optimized Technical Docs for LLMs & Vectorization (PR #1993)
- Moved plugin-web-search readme to root dir (PR #1992)
- Made generateNewTweet public (PR #1902)
- Updated website URL in lore.md (PR #1998)

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text: Several users are experiencing CUDA-related issues with the elizaOS/eliza project. Issue #1994 reports CUDA not being detected, causing transcription to run on CPU instead. Similarly, issue #2080 describes a CUDA error when using `llama_local`, resulting in an exit code 3221226505 error.

Users are encountering various plugin-related issues. The Starknet plugin is reported as outdated in issue #2028. Issue #2078 describes an error with the WhatsApp plugin where users cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'actions'). Issue #2077 proposes a new Nillion nilDB Plugin. Issue #2076 reports that the bot fails to process Telegram messages from other bots despite setting 'shouldIgnoreBotMessages: false'.

Other issues include: a user asking about how to update from version v0.1.7-alpha.2 to v0.1.7 (issue #2035), continuous errors when starting an agent (issue #2024), an inquiry about WASM support for agents (issue #1991), and a security concern about preventing forged public keys from using valid attestations as proof to deceive users (issue #2050).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
The elizaOS/eliza repository has seen several significant pull requests recently, focusing on new plugins, system improvements, and feature enhancements:

- PR #1785 introduced a new RabbiTrader plugin by contributor Freytes, which was later improved in PR #2027 by wtfsayo (which also removed the defillama plugin).

- PR #2010 added a plugin for BÂ² Network, contributed by threewebcode.

- PR #1620 implemented a separate Knowledge system with Multi-Agent RAG Optimization, developed by azep-ninja.

- PR #2038 performed a complete overhaul of the client, contributed by JoeyKhd.

- Two pull requests (#1005 and #2042) focused on 'Proof of Pizza' - an agentic Dominos ordering system, with contributions from ropresearch and bayological respectively.

- Additional maintenance PRs include #2060 for resolving conflicts by yueliao11 and #2041 for development by juansebsol.

Current cryptocurrency prices show fluctuations across major tokens. WETH (Wrapped Ethereum) is trading between $3,327.40 and $3,380.18, showing some volatility. SOL (Solana) is priced between $197.49 and $202.11. WBTC (Wrapped Bitcoin) is valued between $95,062.89 and $96,816.00, maintaining its position as the highest-priced token among those listed. The ai16z token is trading at a lower price point, between $1.71 and $1.87.
All tracked cryptocurrencies show price decreases in their most recent readings compared to earlier values, suggesting a general downward trend in the current market.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed consistent activity over a two-day period. From January 8-9, 2025, there were 36 new pull requests with 38 merged, along with 11 new issues and 82 active contributors. The following day (January 9-10, 2025) saw similar numbers with 37 new pull requests, though with fewer merges at 21, and 7 new issues. The contributor base slightly increased to 83 active contributors.
sources: From 2025-01-08 to 2025-01-09, elizaos/eliza had 36 new PRs (38 merged), 11 new issues, and 82 active contributors.
From 2025-01-09 to 2025-01-10, elizaos/eliza had 37 new PRs (21 merged), 7 new issues, and 83 active contributors.
